_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Cone Ag, Inc. - 2400 E Dakota, Pierre SD  57501





RMP EXECUTIVE SUMMARY



A.     Introduction



This facility is a wholesale and retail farm supply distribution center that stores and distributes a wide variety of pesticides and fertilizers.  Anhydrous Ammonia is received by truck, is handled and stored on-site and is a regulated substance by the EPA requiring us to comply with the Risk Management Program.  Ammonia is used only for blending into mixed grade fertilizers for crop production nutrients. This facility has an excellent safety record with no deaths or serious injuries to plant personnel or contractors due to the RMP covered process. There have been no accidents in the past 5 years.



B.     Accidental Release Prevention Policies and Program



This facility strives to meet or exceed compliance with anhydrous ammonia regulations. Training is provided for each new hire and every year as required by OSHA. The anhydrous ammonia tank(s) and associated equipment are inspected annually following recommended industry and engineering frequencies. Pressurized tank(s) and plumbing are tested according to the standards for the pressure vessel testing.



C.    Emergency Response Policies and Programs



Each employee is trained to be familiar with the emergency response policies and procedures through safety reviews and other safety meetings. This facililty has an Emergency Plan which covers accidental releases, natural disasters, security incidents and other emergency response practices and procedures. The Emergency Plan for this facility is reviewed and updated on an annual basis as part of a comprehensive review process. The Emergency Plan for this facility includes specific instructions for the employees regarding the response procedures to an emergency. The procedures provided in the Emergency Plan are shared with all employees and followed in the event of an emergency. The local emergency planning committee and fire department person

nel are furnished a copy of the Emergency Plan for this facility and invited for a tour on a regular basis.



D.    Worse-Case Scenario/Alternative-Case Scenario



This facility has developed a worse-case and an alternative-case scenario however it has been withheld from this Executive Summary as security-sensitive information as requested by EPA.



E.    Five Year Accident History



This facility has an excellent safety record with no deaths or serious injuries to any of its employees as a result of the RMP covered process. Extensive programs and procedures are in place to maintain this record.



F.    Planned Changes to Improve Safety



Management of this company and facility continuously look for ways to enhance the safety of this location. Safety inspections are conducted which result in corrective actions: annual equipment inspections are also conducted, and detailed environmental health and safety audits are conducted at least every three years.



G.    Summary



The employees of this company are extremely proud of our safety record and vast improvements made in both environmental stewardship and safety. We believe with our programs and policies in place and with the continued efforts of our personnel, we will maintain our safety record and our safe facility environment for the public, our customers and our employees for years to come.







                    Certification Statement for the RPM Program 2 Anhydrous Ammonia







To  the best of the undersigned's knowledge, information and belief formed after reasonable evaluation and by actual knowledge of the facility and process, the information submitted is true, accurate and complete.
